questions.question_text: Which of the following poses the GREATEST privacy risk for client-side application processing?

choices.C: A remote employee placing communication software on a company server
choices.A: Failure of a firewall protecting the company network
choices.D: A distributed denial of service attack (DDoS) on the company network
choices.B: An employee loading personal information on a company laptop

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I wanted to go with C on this one but GREATEST privacy risk for client-side should be "B"

Selected Answer: B
Privacy threat modeling is a structured approach used to identify, analyze, and address potential privacy risks and threats in a system or process. It aims to protect personal data by ensuring that privacy considerations are integrated into the design and implementation of systems.
B. Systematically eliciting and mitigating privacy threats in a software architecture
C is the answer here. Threat modelling is a proactive process of estimating possible risk scenarios.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST represents privacy threat modeling methodology?

choices.C: Reliably estimating a threat actor’s ability to exploit privacy vulnerabilities
choices.B: Systematically eliciting and mitigating privacy threats in a software architecture
choices.A: Mitigating inherent risks and threats associated with privacy control weaknesses
choices.D: Replicating privacy scenarios that reflect representative software usage

choices.A: Access is logged on the virtual private network (VPN).
choices.D: Access is only granted to authorized users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Access is only granted to authorized users.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY consideration to ensure control of remote access is aligned to the privacy policy?

choices.A: The organization lacks a hardware disposal policy.
choices.B: Emails are not consistently encrypted when sent internally.
choices.C: Privacy training is carried out by a service provider.
choices.D: The organization’s privacy policy has not been reviewed in over a year.

discussion.content: A seems cool but I am going with B (Always wear the privacy hat in CDPSE). Failing to consistently encrypt emails, even when sent internally, poses a significant privacy risk. Sensitive personal information could be exposed if the emails are intercepted, either by internal actors or through unintended breaches in the organization's network. Without encryption, data in transit is vulnerable to unauthorized access, potentially leading to a serious breach of privacy and non-compliance with data protection regulations. Example, employees salaries excel sheet sent by mistake either internally or externally is severe privacy breach.

Selected Answer: A
Going with A on this one. B sounds cool... but the GREATEST risk to the organization should be "A"

Selected Answer: B
B. Emails are not consistently encrypted when sent internally.
A. The organization lacks a hardware disposal policy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following scenarios poses the GREATEST risk to an organization from a privacy perspective?

Within a business continuity plan (BCP), which of the following is the MOST important consideration to ensure the ability to restore availability and access to personal data in the event of a data privacy incident?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I suspect A is incorrect as the RPO dictates backup requirements and availability of data. Unless I have misinterpreted the question, I would answer C here.

comments.content: how if the system is cloud based. So the answer should cover both scenario Online and Offline. I also not sure which answer is correct
That is a good point and I can see why you say that. But A is the only option that talks about backup availability. And as the question asks which is "most important" I do think its A.

I think you should look at it this way. The offline backups must be available as step 1. Once you have that access, you can determine if you need to focus on RTO or RPO. But if you don't have access to offline backups then none of the other options will even come into play.
